insights.quote: I think selecting which ones you're going to participate in is a little daunting.
insights.significance: Highlights the overwhelming nature of choices available to newcomers.
insights.insight: Users feel a sense of confusion and pressure when faced with multiple options, impacting their engagement.

insights.significance: Direct feedback on the website's aesthetics and functionality.
insights.insight: A dated design can deter users, suggesting a need for modernization to attract and retain members.

insights.quote: You're going to kind of glaze over it and maybe not go deep into where you want them to go.
insights.significance: Indicates how users may not engage deeply with content due to overwhelming information.
insights.insight: Too much information without clear navigation can lead to user disengagement.

insights.quote: I never once used the website. I used the app.
insights.significance: Contradicts the expectation that the website should be the primary tool.
insights.insight: Users may prefer mobile applications over websites, indicating a shift in how they access information.

insights.quote: I was looking for some committees that I had an interest in or that I had a shared interest in.
insights.significance: Reveals specific user needs when considering membership.
insights.insight: Users are motivated by shared interests and social connections, highlighting the need for targeted information.

insights.quote: It looks like something that was very simply put together and not intended to be drawing individuals in.
insights.significance: Critique of the website's design and purpose.
insights.insight: Website design needs to evoke interest and engagement, indicating it may currently fail to do so.

insights.quote: It might be nice if it showed up as a thumbnail on the original events page.
insights.insight: Users prefer streamlined access to information, which can enhance their experience.

insights.quote: Too many words. It's way too much detail.
insights.insight: Users prefer concise information; verbosity can lead to disengagement.

insights.quote: You need to pick or focus on a few things that you really want to highlight.
insights.insight: Users need clear priorities in information presentation to avoid feeling overwhelmed.

insights.quote: I think you need to come up with that and maybe test it or test it with a focus group or trial audience.
insights.insight: User feedback should inform design changes, emphasizing the importance of user-centered design.

insights.quote: I just think it makes you look very small.
insights.significance: Comments on the perceived credibility of the organization based on its online presence.
insights.insight: An uninviting web presence can undermine the organization's perceived stature and relevance.

insights.quote: There is a regulation with the website that it needs to have a translation aspect to it.
insights.significance: Brings attention to compliance and accessibility.
insights.insight: Accessibility features are crucial for inclusivity, indicating a gap in current offerings.

insights.quote: If you have, you would list them here. But if you don't, then you wouldn't call it a level.
insights.significance: Points out a potential confusion in membership levels.
insights.insight: Clear communication of membership options is essential to avoid user confusion.

insights.quote: I think the color scheme is not very inviting or exciting either way.
insights.significance: Feedback on the visual elements of the website.
insights.insight: A lack of inviting design elements can negatively affect user attraction and engagement.
